result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Pierre Rush

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Andre Pierre Rush in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  No attorney has been appointed yet. Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre Pierre Rush appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre Pierre Rush in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Andre Pierre Rush appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with D.S
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andre Pierre Rush in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Andre Pierre Rush in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
